hudson.tasks.Shell.command:
#!/bin/bash CLUSTER_NAME=visage-api-cluster-prod REGION=us-west-2 COMPOSE_FILE="docker-compose.prod.yml" MONGO_CONTAINER_NAME=mongo-visage PERSISTENCE_TASK_NAME=persist-deploy-prod ELASTIC_CONTAINER_NAME=elasticsearch MYSQL_AMB_CONTAINER=ambassador-mysql IMAGE_VERSION=${VERSION_NUMBER} TASK_NAME=node-deploy-prod SERVICE_NAME=visage-api-prod-service
print_service_status() { aws ecs describe-services --cluster $CLUSTER_NAME --services $SERVICE_NAME }
/usr/local/bin/ecs-cli configure --region $REGION --cluster $CLUSTER_NAME
aws ecs update-service --cluster $CLUSTER_NAME --service $SERVICE_NAME --desired-count 0
aws ecs delete-service --cluster $CLUSTER_NAME --service $SERVICE_NAME
while ! DRAINING_SERVICES=$(print_service_status 2> /dev/null) || [ "$(echo $DRAINING_SERVICES | grep 'DRAINING' | wc -l)" -ne 0 ] ; do echo "Deleted services are still draining..." sleep 5 done
cd persistence
#set elastic search PWD sed -e "s,{{PROD_VISAGE_ES_USER_NAME}},$PROD_VISAGE_ES_USER_NAME," \ -e "s,{{PROD_VISAGE_MYSQL_ROOT_PASSWORD}},$PROD_VISAGE_MYSQL_ROOT_PASSWORD," \ -e "s,{{PROD_VISAGE_ES_USER_PWD}},$PROD_VISAGE_ES_USER_PWD," -i.bak ${COMPOSE_FILE}
# Create only the task definitions with ecs cli because we can t set a load balancer with ecs-cli for now # https://github.com/aws/amazon-ecs-cli/issues/21 #/usr/local/bin/ecs-cli compose --file ${COMPOSE_FILE} --project-name $TASK_NAME service rm
FULL_MONGO=$(/usr/local/bin/ecs-cli ps | grep "$MONGO_CONTAINER_NAME" | grep "${PERSISTENCE_TASK_NAME}" | grep "RUNNING" | grep 'tcp' | awk '{print $3}' | sed 's/->\|\/\|:/ /g') HOST_MONGO=$(echo $FULL_MONGO | awk '{print $1}') PORT_MONGO=$(echo $FULL_MONGO | awk '{print $2}') echo "mongo : $FULL_MONGO"
FULL_ELASTIC_SEARCH=$(/usr/local/bin/ecs-cli ps | grep "${ELASTIC_CONTAINER_NAME}" | grep "${PERSISTENCE_TASK_NAME}" | grep "RUNNING" | grep 'tcp' | awk '{print $3}' | sed 's/->\|\/\|:/ /g') HOST_ELASTIC_SEARCH=$(echo $FULL_ELASTIC_SEARCH | awk '{print $1}') PORT_ELASTIC_SEARCH=$(echo $FULL_ELASTIC_SEARCH | awk '{print $2}') echo "elastic : $FULL_ELASTIC_SEARCH"
FULL_MYSQL_SENDY=$(/usr/local/bin/ecs-cli ps | grep "${MYSQL_AMB_CONTAINER}" | grep "${PERSISTENCE_TASK_NAME}" | grep "RUNNING" | grep 'tcp' | awk '{print $3}' | sed 's/->\|\/\|:/ /g') HOST_MYSQL_SENDY=$(echo $FULL_MYSQL_SENDY | awk '{print $1}') PORT_MYSQL_SENDY=$(echo $FULL_MYSQL_SENDY | awk '{print $2}') echo "mysql sendy : $FULL_MYSQL_SENDY"
#Main directory cd ..
#Link with mongodb aws and set the build number sed -e "s,{{HOST_MONGO}},$HOST_MONGO,g" \ -e "s,{{PORT_MONGO}},$PORT_MONGO,g" \ -e "s,{{PROD_VISAGE_MYSQL_ROOT_PASSWORD}},$PROD_VISAGE_MYSQL_ROOT_PASSWORD,g" \ -e "s,{{NODE_BACKEND_USER}},$NODE_BACKEND_USER,g" \ -e "s,{{HOST_ELASTIC_SEARCH}},$HOST_ELASTIC_SEARCH,g" \ -e "s,{{PORT_ELASTIC_SEARCH}},$PORT_ELASTIC_SEARCH,g" \ -e "s,{{PROD_REDIS_PASSWORD}},$PROD_REDIS_PASSWORD,g" \ -e "s,{{HOST_MYSQL_SENDY}},$HOST_MYSQL_SENDY,g" \ -e "s,{{PORT_MYSQL_SENDY}},$PORT_MYSQL_SENDY,g" \ -e "s,{{VERSION_NUMBER}},$VERSION_NUMBER,g" \ -e "s,{{PROD_AWS_SECRET_ACCESS_KEY}},$PROD_AWS_SECRET_ACCESS_KEY,g" \ -e "s,{{PROD_AWS_ACCESS_KEY_ID}},$PROD_AWS_ACCESS_KEY_ID,g" -i.bak ${COMPOSE_FILE}
/usr/local/bin/ecs-cli compose --file ${COMPOSE_FILE} --project-name $TASK_NAME create &> outnode.log TASK_WEB=$(grep 'TaskDefinition' outnode.log | awk -F "=" '{gsub("\"","",$5);print $5}') echo "taskweb : $TASK_WEB"
aws ecs create-service --cluster $CLUSTER_NAME --service-name $SERVICE_NAME --task-definition $TASK_WEB --load-balancers loadBalancerName=ecs-elb-backend-prod,containerName=web,containerPort=3000 --role ecs-service-role --desired-count 1 #Ensure node service is stable echo 'waiting for node service to be stable and node task to be run' aws ecs wait services-stable --cluster $CLUSTER_NAME --services $SERVICE_NAME echo 'Deployment completed!'

info.scriptContent: #!/bin/bash echo "VERSION_NUMBER="$(cat package.json | grep version | awk '{print $2}' | sed -e 's/"//g' -e "s/'//g" -e 's/,//g' ) > version.properties
